Topic.Title: Microprocessors aren't green

Message.Msg: Intel's bread and butter is microprocessors. It's been making them for over 40 years. The point of this post is to make you, as an investor in Intel, aware that microprocessors are not green. If the future becomes more and more green conscious, as it likely may, microprocessor vendors such as Intel will have to change the subject of their research. People may choose IC technology that is green over performance or cost or existing supply chain optimizations.

Topic.Title: Went ex-Dividend and we are actually up a Dime, correct?

Message.Msg: The adjusted closing price on Friday, Nov 2 was $22.06. Today is ex-dividend day and the unchanged opening price will be adjusted down by 22.5 cents to $21.84 or $21.83 depending on rounding rules. When Intel trades at $21.84/3 it is unchanged. Trading at $22.00 is up by 16 or 17 cents. The high was $22.03 so that would be a little below the Friday close so it would be nearer to 20 cents.

Message.Title: Intel Announces Intel® SSD DC S3700 Series -- Next-Generation Data Center Solid-State Drive
Message.Msg: A couple interesting part of this announcement involve the large drive size, the consistent access latency, and most of all, the improvement in WRITE time. The consistent access time means that Intel has worked around the problems with the wear algorithms. SSD's map the blocks so they are equally accessed and a block does not wear out. Early algorithms and many in play today will stop the writing if they are shuffling data around. This is terrible for enterprise apps that depend on response times. Disk accesses pile up behind this shuffling and choke the system. WIth a 15x improvement in write times, these non-volatile memories are getting close to providing a large, non-volatile, random access memory for low power systems. If a system (smartphone or tablet or Ultrabook) has a large non-volatile memory, then applcations don't have to be written to disk before going to sleep. Talk about fast startup time. Intel SSD DC S3700 Delivers Consistent Performance, Protection and High Endurance to Meet the Needs of HPC, Big Data, Cloud and Other Data Center Applications NEWS HIGHLIGHTS Intel SSD DC S3700 Series offers next-generation storage performance to meet the needs of today’s big data, HPC and cloud-computing apps. Low latencies and consistent IOPS performance delivers 2x read and 15x write improvements over previous generation Intel® SSD 710 Series. Offered in 100-/200-/400-/800GB capacities, new SSD delivers on all fronts: fast performance, strong data protection and high endurance.

Message.Title: Economy Set for Better Times Whether Obama or Romney Wins - Bloomberg
Message.Msg: Bloomberg: Economy Set for Better Times Whether Obama or Romney Wins No matter who wins the election tomorrow, the economy is on course to enjoy faster growth in the next four years as the headwinds that have held it back turn into tailwinds. Consumers are spending more and saving less after reducing household debt to the lowest since 2003. Home prices are rebounding after falling more than 30 percent from their 2006 highs. And banks are increasing lending after boosting equity capital by more than $300 billion since 2009. “The die is cast for a much stronger recovery,” said Mark Zandi, chief economist in West Chester, Pennsylvania, for Moody’s Analytics Inc. He sees growth this year and next at about 2 percent before doubling to around 4 percent in both 2014 and 2015 as consumption, construction and hiring all pick up. WHOEVER WINS THIS ELECTION WILL GET THE CREDIT.

Message.Title: Apple Exploring Water and Air
Message.Msg: Apple engineers are exploring the use of water and air to power their computers in the future. They claim the cost savings will be huge and see no compromise in performance. These new computers should be up and running sometime within the next 20 years and will start of wave of excitement. New software will need to be written that can withstand the elements but the use of umbrellas will help to overcome any potential water problems. Apple engineers believe that the control of the Air flow can be accomplished with baffles and blades and mechanical levers from drawstrings attached to the outside. The challenge will be to design umbrellas small enough to fit inside. Stay tuned for updates from the Apple Research Center for the Use of Water and Air Without the Need for Any Intel Processors...

Topic.Title: Bloomberg News: Apple Exploring switch from intel chips for:

Message.Msg: Apple is losing ground on both its iPhone and tablets to Android smartphones and tablets. Interestingly these are the both products that use ARM CPUs. The biggest mistake Apple could make is to alienate its loyal MAC users by degrading its laptops and desktops with slow processors. The creative types would drop Apple in a heartbeat if Apple can't keep pace with x86 PCs for Adobe Premiere Pro, Avid and similar software. Second mistake would be to force a tablet interface on desktop users the way Microsoft is alienating desktop users with W8 UI.

Message.Title: Why Apple is switching to ARM?
Message.Msg: There many too many reasons to enumerate. I think the days of Intel processors are becoming over. Tablets, smartphones, and Chrome based PC are all ARM based. Microsoft is starting to write code on ARM based processors.

Message.Msg: And get rid of that hanger on mu.

Topic.Title: Everything is switching to ARM!!!

Message.Msg: Ask Apple, Google, Motorola, Samsung, Nvidia, Texas Instruments, HTC, Huawei, RIMM and NOK how are they doing with their ARM based smartphones and Tablets and tell me how are the PC's are doing compared to them.

Topic.Title: Apple also Said : If this takes place it:

Message.Msg: The sad thing is that Intel cannot catch up with ARM. They are nowhere in sight in the rear view mirror. Tablet computing is in the early stage of development. Watch in the next 5 years and see what will happen

Message.Title: apple switching to arm is not new news
Message.Msg: Not sure why everyone thinks it's fresh off the press

Message.Title: Apple has more to worry about Intel
Message.Msg: Convertible ultrabook will kill the iPad and Apple will get very #$%$ off..

Message.Title: 2 things you need to know about the Apple chip business
Message.Msg: First, Apple and Intel have a non compete agreement regarding the chip technology, so if Apple pulls out, Intel can use the technology however it wants. And secondly, because of that non compete agreement, the existing business will continue for 1-2 more years.

Message.Title: Something you should know about Apple & ARM's chip
Message.Msg: ARM's new Cortex A-57 appears very impressive, albeit two years from market. That is why INTC has 2 years to save grace....
